content: Awesome article! So many times I’ve seen people assume that their good intentions were the only thing that really counted, so I gathered a few quotes for them, from “The Quiet American” by Graham Greene: “I never knew a man who had better motives for all the trouble he caused.” “He was impregnably armored by his good intentions and his ignorance.” “I wish sometimes you had a few bad motives, you might understand a little more about human beings.” “God save us always,’ I said ‘from the innocent and the good.”
